replies.body: Lots of people don't even USE their teamspeak, or have gone inactive. Really the only teams I see that use their teamspeak channel is Apollo and Cronus. Everyone else has their own private teamspeak server, has skype, or doesn't scrim anymore. Plus, every teamspeak has no point because if a member leaves the team, he tells everyone the password. It's not necessary to have a "private" teamspeak channel, when anyone could come in.
replies.body_tagged: Lots of people don't even USE their teamspeak, or have gone inactive. Really the only teams I see that use their teamspeak channel is Apollo and Cronus. Everyone else has their own private teamspeak server, has skype, or doesn't scrim anymore. Plus, every teamspeak has no point because if a member leaves the team, he tells everyone the password. It's not necessary to have a "private" teamspeak channel, when anyone could come in.

replies.body:
You're telling me you've never seen that before? Wow well let me explain some reasons to you.

1. If a channels overcrowded and you move to a different channel, and people follow you, because they think your moving for a different reason, you ask your friend "let's join your teams channel" and boom you have the password.

2. Added to a team channel as a sub
3. Wanna play some mini games with people in that channel so they invite you in.

Etc.

You can't change the password, only staff can. I'm sure they don't want to be changing passwords all day
replies.body_tagged:
You're telling me you've never seen that before? Wow well let me explain some reasons to you.

1. If a channels overcrowded and you move to a different channel, and people follow you, because they think your moving for a different reason, you ask your friend "let's join your teams channel" and boom you have the password.

2. Added to a team channel as a sub
3. Wanna play some mini games with people in that channel so they invite you in.

Etc.

You can't change the password, only staff can. I'm sure they don't want to be changing passwords all day
